page.title: 17SOCIAL CONCERNS
page.content: MANY OF THE PEOPLE WHOM WE INTRVIEWED EXPRESSED CONCERN FOR THE MAINTAINANCE OF A SLOWER PACE OF LIFE IN THE AREA. SEVERAL FAMILIES HAVE LIVED IN THE AREA FOR GENERATIONS AND ARE KEEN TO SEE IT PRESERVED IN ITS PRESENT FORM. HOWEVER, THERE IS AN INCREASING MOVEMENT OF YOUNGER PEOPLE TOWARDS THE URBAN CENTRE OF NORTHAMPTON WHERE BOTH EMPLOYMENT AND PROPERTY PRICES ARE MORE CONDUCIVE TO THEIR NEEDS. OLDER RESIDENTS EXPRESS A RELUCTANCE TO LEAVE THEIR HOMES IN THE EVENING AS THEY HEAR TALES OF PEOPLE BEING ATTACKED, ROBBED OR BURGLED. MOTHERS OF YOUNG CHILDREN FEAR FOR THEIR SAFETY BOTH ON THE ROADS AND FROM MOLESTERS, EVEN DURING DAYLIGHT HOURS ON QUIET THOROUGHFARES. SINCE THE AREA IS FAST BECOMING A DORMITORY FOR NORTHAMPTON, PEOPLE ARE CONCERNED THAT VILLAGE LIFE MAY FADE.
